But don‚Äôt get too riled up: It would take a miracle for this bendy building to rise in NYC. That‚Äôs not necessarily because it‚Äôs structurally impossible ‚Äî the firm‚Äôs architect, Ioannis Oikonomou, thinks it‚Äôs an ‚Äúachievable scenario.‚Äù Instead, you can blame (or thank) the city‚Äôs strict zoning laws for keeping this off the skyline.
Still, Oiio dares to dream of a time when the arch could rise. ‚ÄúThe Big Bend can become a modest architectural solution to the height limitations of Manhattan,‚Äù the firm wrote in a statement. ‚ÄúWe can now provide our structures with the measurements that will make them stand out without worrying about the limits of the sky.‚Äù
